titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. James Lewis, Elijah Mercer, John Gaines, James Godsey, Allen Moore, James Moore James McIntosh, S. R. Begley, James Gaines Geo. W. Houk, Danl. Smith, John Key, Andrew Combs, Milton Combs, & Andrew Robin, Indictment
CWG5338

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Perry Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
agst Indict
James Lewis, Elijah Mercer, John Gaines, James Godsey, Allen Moore, James Moore James McIntosh, S. R. Begley, James Gaines Geo. W. Houk, Danl. Smith, John Key, Andrew Combs, Milton Combs, Andrew Robin

The Grand Jury of Perry County in the name and by the authority of the Comlth of Kentucky accuse James Lewis &c of the Crime of Murder, Committed as follows the said James Lewis &c did in the County aforesaid on the 10th of Oct 1865, wilfully & with Malice aforethought kill & Murder, Garlin Combs, (alias Henry Combs) by shooting Him with Guns & Pistols against the peace & dignity of the Comlth of Kentucky

A Copy attest,
James Gaim
Comlth
agt } Indict
G. W. Houk &cKilling
Henry Combs
